content.rendered:
The reason JavaScript is often so favored by new developers is that it is a higher-level language, and so many of the complexities of your code are done by the machine instead of in your code.

JavaScript offers a simple syntax that somewhat resembles the English language, which makes it easy to build strong mental connections to the programming concepts you are covering.

In addition, because JavaScript is a web development technology, it’s very easy to get started with coding in the language. All you need to do is open up your web browser and find an interactive tutorial to start interacting with JavaScript code. There really is very little you need to do to set up a development environment when you are getting started.

excerpt.rendered: The reason JavaScript is often so favored by new developers is that it is a higher-level language, and so many of the complexities of your code are done by the machine instead of in your code. JavaScript offers a simple syntax that somewhat resembles the English language, which makes it easy to build strong mental […]

title.rendered: JavaScript Is a Versatile Programming Language

content.rendered:
One of the major reasons why JavaScript is preferred by new developers is because the language is very versatile; therefore, it can be used for a wide range of purposes.

JavaScript allows you to add many interactive features to a website, from video players to functional buttons to images that change when clicked.

That’s not all. So-called “vanilla JavaScript” (where you only use JavaScript) is only part of coding in JavaScript. Once you’ve mastered the basics of JavaScript, you can extend your skills and use them to master a library like Angular, Vue.js, and React.js. These technologies are all used for web development in a wide range of different contexts.

You can also use the skills you’ve mastered while learning JavaScript with a framework like Node.js to build back end web applications. Or you can use your JavaScript skills with React Native or another mobile framework to build a mobile app.

excerpt.rendered: One of the major reasons why JavaScript is preferred by new developers is because the language is very versatile; therefore, it can be used for a wide range of purposes. JavaScript allows you to add many interactive features to a website, from video players to functional buttons to images that change when clicked. That’s not […]

title.rendered: JavaScript Developers Are in High Demand

content.rendered:
The market demand for qualified JavaScript developers is huge.

Whether or not you are looking to start a career in tech today, it is always comforting to know that the skills you are building can be transferred over when needed. In the case of JavaScript, because it is such a crucial part of the internet, there are companies that are constantly looking for talented developers with JavaScript proficiency.

The TIOBE Index, which uses search engine results to estimate the popularity of the main programming languages, currently ranks JavaScript as the seventh most popular programming language (as of April 22nd, 2020).

Do you need more convincing? According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, demand for web developers is expected to rise by 13% by 2028. While this statistic does not track JavaScript specifically, it does give us a strong indication of how demand for web developers is increasing. If that was not enough, as of April 22nd, 2020, Glassdoor is featuring 21,495 jobs for JavaScript developers!

When taken into account collectively, these facts paint a clear picture of how learning JavaScript can impact your career. In addition, if you specialize in skills such as React.js or Node.js, you may even find yourself in even higher demand, as these frameworks grow in popularity and are used in an increasing number of applications.

excerpt.rendered: The market demand for qualified JavaScript developers is huge. Whether or not you are looking to start a career in tech today, it is always comforting to know that the skills you are building can be transferred over when needed. In the case of JavaScript, because it is such a crucial part of the internet, […]

title.rendered: JavaScript Has a Massive Developer Community

content.rendered:
Given how JavaScript is one of the most popular programming languages in the world, it is no surprise that the language has a massive community of followers.

What does this mean for you? First, having access to a large developer community makes it easy to find other like-minded peers who can help you along your journey. Do you have a bug that you can’t fix? You could ask for help in a community. Do you need help understanding a concept? You could ask another developer.

Second, the large JavaScript developer community means that it is easy for you to find opportunities to help others. Once you’ve mastered the fundamentals, then you can start contributing to communities with solutions to problems and give back to the ecosystem that helped you to be where you are today.

StackOverflow, Dev.to, Hashnode, and GitHub are just a few of the many communities with dedicated JavaScript followers, but those communities only scratch the surface of all the developers out there who actively talk about JavaScript.

excerpt.rendered: Given how JavaScript is one of the most popular programming languages in the world, it is no surprise that the language has a massive community of followers. What does this mean for you? First, having access to a large developer community makes it easy to find other like-minded peers who can help you along your […]

title.rendered: Learning Resources Are All over the Internet

content.rendered:
The JavaScript language, and the top frameworks built upon the language like React, are well-documented. As a result, you should have no problem finding materials that you can use to assist you in learning.

Online, there are thousands of free tutorials you can follow to help you learn how to code in JavaScript. In addition, if you are looking for a more intensive course, there are also a number of coding bootcamps such as Flatiron School, Lambda School, and Microverse which can help you craft the skills you are looking to build.

If books are more your style, there are dozens of great reads out there such as You Don’t Know JS and JavaScript: The Definitive Guide.

excerpt.rendered: The JavaScript language, and the top frameworks built upon the language like React, are well-documented. As a result, you should have no problem finding materials that you can use to assist you in learning. Online, there are thousands of free tutorials you can follow to help you learn how to code in JavaScript. In addition, […]

content.rendered:
If you are interested in learning JavaScript to break into a career in tech, there is good news for you: JavaScript developers command impressive salaries.

Data from Glassdoor show that the average JavaScript developer earns $76,526 per year (as of March 15, 2020), and more experienced developers command even higher salaries. And, if you specialize in a web framework like React.js, you could be earning even more!

Data from Glassdoor show that the average JavaScript developer earns $76,526 per year (as of March 15, 2020), and more experienced developers command even higher salaries. And, if you specialize in a […]

title.rendered: It’s the most popular programming language

content.rendered: We start our list with possibly the most significant reason! According to Stackoverflow.com, JavaScript is the most popular programming language used by professional developers today. Even back-end developers choose JavaScript more often than not.

excerpt.rendered: We start our list with possibly the most significant reason! According to Stackoverflow.com, JavaScript is the most popular programming language used by professional developers today. Even back-end developers choose JavaScript more often than not.

content.rendered: JavaScript is, without question, the default language of the internet. You need to look no further than your browser for proof since JavaScript was most likely used to develop it. Since browsers are a necessary part of any user’s online experience, it’s easy to see why JavaScript is so significant.

excerpt.rendered: JavaScript is, without question, the default language of the internet. You need to look no further than your browser for proof since JavaScript was most likely used to develop it. Since browsers are a necessary part of any user’s online experience, it’s easy to see why JavaScript is so significant.

title.rendered: JavaScript also exists outside of the internet

content.rendered: JavaScript has many uses that go beyond its traditional internet roles. It powers smart televisions, works with the internet of things (IoT), creates native apps for iOS and Android, and builds cross-platform desktop apps, to name a few.

excerpt.rendered: JavaScript has many uses that go beyond its traditional internet roles. It powers smart televisions, works with the internet of things (IoT), creates native apps for iOS and Android, and builds cross-platform desktop apps, to name a few.

content.rendered:
Since it’s already installed on every web browser today, JavaScript spares the rookies from the chore of setting up a development environment. Newcomers can just jump in and start coding. It’s one of the most accessible entries into coding available, a value-add for beginners. There is also a large online community that offers support and advice.

Also, JavaScript is an excellent tool for beginning programmers who want to expand their skill set into other languages. JavaScript supports valuable skills such as object-oriented, functional, and imperative styles of programming. Beginner developers, in turn, can apply these skills to any new language they want to learn, like Python, Java, or C++.

excerpt.rendered: Since it’s already installed on every web browser today, JavaScript spares the rookies from the chore of setting up a development environment. Newcomers can just jump in and start coding. It’s one of the most accessible entries into coding available, a value-add for beginners. There is also a large online community that offers support and […]

content.rendered: Not only is it a natural language to use, but JavaScript is also easy to pick up. JavaScript turns intricate details into abstracts, making things easier for the newcomer. Unlike the higher-level languages, JavaScript has more of a natural language feel to it.

excerpt.rendered: Not only is it a natural language to use, but JavaScript is also easy to pick up. JavaScript turns intricate details into abstracts, making things easier for the newcomer. Unlike the higher-level languages, JavaScript has more of a natural language feel to it.

title.rendered: You Can Create Visual Effects and Other Eye-catching Aesthetic Features

content.rendered: There’s building a web page, and then there’s building a visually appealing web page that attracts the user’s attention and encourages interaction. JavaScript is so versatile that you can use it to easily add cool design elements such as animation, interactive maps, and scrolling video. Organizations and clients want web designers who can not only put together a technically sound page but one that also will lure visitors. If you know JavaScript, you can deliver.

excerpt.rendered: There’s building a web page, and then there’s building a visually appealing web page that attracts the user’s attention and encourages interaction. JavaScript is so versatile that you can use it to easily add cool design elements such as animation, interactive maps, and scrolling video. Organizations and clients want web designers who can not only […]

content.rendered:
Far from being a one-trick pony, JavaScript empowers a programmer to handle any aspect of app design. Do you want to do user-side (front-end) coding? You can do it in conjunction with Angular. Are you more interested in the server-side (back-end)? Bring Node.js into the mix and you can do that, too!

You can also create desktop, mobile, and web apps with Electron, React Native, and React. If you’re intrigued by machine learning, then JavaScript will help you there as well.

You can do it in conjunction with Angular. Are you more interested in the server-side (back-end)? Bring Node.js into the mix and you can do that, too! You can also […]

title.rendered: JavaScript also Affects Big Data and the Cloud

content.rendered:
avaScript Object Notation (JSON) is the go-to standard for data exchanges on today’s internet. NoSQL databases use JSON documents for record storage; and although JSON plays well with any programming language, it does best with JavaScript.

Also, more developers are turning to Node.js to build cloud-based apps, a very much in-demand market.

NoSQL databases use JSON documents for record storage; and although JSON plays well with any programming language, it does best with JavaScript. Also, more developers are turning to Node.js to build cloud-based apps, a very much in-demand market.
